;
ASCD
THE ASSOCIATION FOR SUPERVISION AND CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT
A DEPARTMENT OF THE NATIONAL EDUCATION ASSOCIATION 1201 16TH STREET, N.W., WASHINGTON 6, D.C. ADAMS 4-4848
November 2J, 1962
Mr. Harold E. Hill
Vice President
National Association of
Educational Broadcasters
1346 Connecticut Avenue
Washington 6, D.C.
Dear Mr. Hill;
Thank you for your November 14 letter to Dr. Gill -with
regard to the possibility of NAEB participating in the 1963
ASCD Conference in St. Louis, Missouri, March 10-l4.
We are certain that ve can make arrangements for your
exhibit but it is a little early to make commitments. Will
it be all right to hold this until late December and I -will
call you.
Executive Committee 1962-63: President, CHESTER BABCOCK, Assistant Superintendent, State Department of Public Instruction, Olympia, Washington • President-
Elect, KIMBALL WILES, Professor of Education, University of Florida, Gainesville, Florida • Vice President, WILLIAM VAN TIL, Professor and Chairman, Department
of Secondary Education, New York University, New York, N. Y. • GEORGE DENEMARK, Dean, School of Education, University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee, Milwaukee
Wisconsin • ALEXANDER FRAZIER, Director, Center for School Experimentation, The Ohio State University, Columbus, Ohio • ARTHUR J. LEWIS, Assistant Superin¬
tendent, Minneapolis Public Schools, 807 N. E. Broadway, Minneapolis, Minnesota • LILLIAN C. PAUKNER, Director, Division of Curriculum and Instruction
Upper Grade Department, Milwaukee Public Schools, Milwaukee, Wisconsin
STAFF: Executive Secretary MARGARET GILL Associate Secretary M. KARL OPENSHAW Associate Secretary; Editor of ASCD Publications ROBERT R. LEEPER
